bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis B. Pogolotti, November 6, 1940

div1.p: Hench discusses his associates' interest in preserving Building No. 1. He plans to publish his data on the location of Camp Lazear in hopes that the Cubans will be interested in this information.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Luis B. Pogolotti, November 6, 1940
div1.p:
I am leaving tomorrow for a medical speaking jaunt for ten days and
in preparation for it have been so busy since my return from Washington that
I haven't had time to write you. We had a delightful time in Washington and
I hope that Mr. Moran has told you something of it. I know that you will be
interested in the enclosed clippings from the paper. Should you wish two or
three more of the Rochester clipping, I think I can get them for you.

Many friends were most interested in our venture to preserve Building
No. 1, and while it may take a little time to raise the money, I am sure I can
do it. When I return from this trip, I hope I can have a little more time to
write you about various matters. Needless to say, I am most gratified by Mr.
Macia's attitude.

I will be publishing my Washington, Pennsylvania talk, and will send
you some reprints of it, as I think you might be interested in giving some to
your friends. I will also, in this next month or so, write up in formal fashion,
our data regarding the location of Camp Lazear, to you to submit to Dr. Ramos
and other interested parties. Regardless of what he does with it, we will
publish it, and as I told you, I insist on having you and Mr. Moran as co-authors
on this paper.

Permit me to stop now, but you will hear from me in a couple of
weeks.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
